questions.question: What does the infinite dilution activity coefficient represent?

answers.a: The behavior of solutes at high concentrations.
answers.b: The effect of solvent-solute interactions at infinitesimal concentrations.
answers.c: The relationship between vapor pressure and temperature.
answers.d: The solubility limit of a solute in a solvent.

questions.question: When $$ \gamma_i^{\infty} = 1 $$ , what does it indicate about the solute behavior?

answers.a: The solute behaves ideally at infinite dilution.
answers.b: The solute exhibits strong interactions with the solvent.
answers.c: The solute is insoluble in the solvent.
answers.d: The solute causes the solution to become non-ideal.

questions.question: Which equation is often applied to predict the vapor pressure of the solvent using the infinite dilution activity coefficient?
What implication does a $$ \gamma_i^∞  $$ value greater than one signify?

answers.d: The solute is completely miscible with the solvent.
